revisionDesc.change: Still need to add info on history; bibliography

head.title: Martianus Capella (VIII book), Excerptum de astrologia, Abbo of Fleury

note.rs: Excerptio Abbonis ex Higino de figuratione signorum

msItem.title: De nuptiis Philologiae et Mercurii. Book VIII. De astronomia
msItem.author: Martianus Capella
msItem.rubric: MARTIANI MINEI FELICIS CAPELAE INCIPIT DE ASTROLOGIA LIBER VIII de nupciis philologie
msItem.incipit: Que dum geruntur et deorum sacer senatus
msItem.explicit: qui eas percutiens aut in sublime tollit aut in profundum deprimit aut in latitudinem declinare aut retrogradari facit.
msItem.note: Interlinear glosses by the same hand, and marginal by a different one.

msItem.incipit: Acrobius ormicretes hoc est somniorum iudex uel interpres
msItem.explicit: qui ut multis placet autor fuit in scribendo hoc libello
msItem.note: humanist hand using blank opening page (?)

msItem.author: Macrobius
msItem.title: Commentarium in Ciceronis somnium Scipionis
msItem.incipit: INTER PLATONIS ET CICERONIS libros quos de re publica utrumque constituisse constat
msItem.note: many interlinear and marginal notes as in Martianus text.

msItem.author: Cicero
msItem.title: Somnium Scipionis
msItem.incipit: TESTUS SONNII. CUM IN AFRICAM UENISSEM A MANLIO CONSULE AD quartam legionm tribunus
msItem.explicit: Ille discessit. ego somno solutes sum.

msItem.title: Excerptum de astronomia
msItem.incipit: DVO SUNT extremi uertices mundi quos appellant polos
msItem.explicit: quę ad ipsum usque decurrit accipiens.

msItem.title: Excerptio Abbonis ex higino de figuratione signorum
msItem.incipit: Denique ut dicit plinius inter omnia sunt LXXII signa…
msItem.note: continues the text from the Excerptum, no mark for starting a different/ new text.

msItem.author: Abbo of Fleury
msItem.title: Sententia Abbonis de differentia circuli et sperae
msItem.incipit: Studiosis astrologię primo sciendum est per geometricam
msItem.explicit: si uero mota est aliquis planetarum est. FIGURA AD SUPERIORA DICTA UTILIS.
msItem.note: added a circular figure of the apsides (ala Pliny) – in the edition of Thomson the other Pliny diagram ‘per zodiacum’ used (heart-rate)

msItem.author: Abbo of Fleury
msItem.title: Untitled
msItem.incipit: Denique luna totius zodiaci signa puncta partes
msItem.explicit: in artem modo esse credimus. Similiter in reliquas.
msItem.note: diagram of the lunar phases on f. 73v

msItem.title: De duodecim signis
msItem.incipit: Regionem duodecim caeli in qua sol cursum suum dirigit
msItem.explicit: quę diabolicus error confirmauit. Sed xps dominus saluator mundi euertit.

msItem.note: Adelbodus, Epistola ad Gerbertum (Adalbold, bishop of Utrecht, d. 1026)
msItem.incipit: Domino Silvestro summo pontifici et philosopho uite felicitatem et felicitates perpetuitatem Macrobius super somnium scipionis ubi loquitur
msItem.note: print in PL 140, 1103-1110, Bubnov p. 300-9. Here with abridgements (missing opening of the letter and end)
Anonymous, Commentary to the arithmetica of Boethius (?)
msItem.incipit: Sicut et in aliis in primis uidere debemus quę sit materia huius operis. Materia igitur est numerus per se
msItem.explicit: postquam dixit unitatem esse eiusdem substantie ideo repetit ea que tunc dixit.

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: De arithmetica
msItem.incipit: Domino patricio Symmacho Boetius In dandis accipiendisque muneribus ita recte officia inter eos praecipue
msItem.explicit: huius autem descriptionnis subter exemplar adiecimus. then another line that is not legible online
msItem.note: followed on 127v by the usual closing diagram of geometria, arithemtica, harmonica an consonantiae.

supportDesc.condition: The first folios have circular rust marks probably from previous bosses.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled on dry point, no ruling for marginal glosses for Martianus.

listBibl.head: Selected bibliography:
listBibl.bibl: Lippincott, Kristen. ‘Between Text and Image. Incident and Accident in the History of Astronomical and Astrological Illustration’. In L’art de La Renaissance Entre Science et Magie, edited by Philippe Morel, 3–34. Rome: Somogy, 2006.

Zucker, Arnaud. ‘Exploring the Relevance of the Star-Positions in the Medieval Illuminated Manuscripts of Hyginus’ De Astronomia’. In Certissima Signa. A Venice Conference on Greek and Latin Astronomical Texts, edited by Filippomaria Pontani, 153–212. Venice: Ca’Foscari, 2017.
